etymology.description: Depicts a cong (琮, a ritual jade totem)
etymology.interpretation: 玉(玉) (yù, "jade") visually represents the concept of jade, either as a cong or three pieces of jade strung together. It is distinct from 王(王) (wáng, "king") thanks to the added dot, ensuring clarity in their usage and meaning.

examples.chinese: 他收藏了一块古玉(他收藏了一塊古玉)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shōucáng le yī kuài gǔ yù.
examples.english: He collected a piece of antique jade.

examples.chinese: 晴空万里时(晴空萬里時)，玉石在阳光下闪烁(玉石在陽光下閃爍)。
examples.pinyin: Qíngkōng wànlǐ shí, yù shí zài yángguāng xià shǎnshuò.
examples.english: Under a clear sky, the jade sparkled under the sunlight.

examples.chinese: 在宫廷中(在宮廷中)，玉制的饰物象征着高贵(玉製的飾物象徵著高貴)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gōngtíng zhōng, yù zhì de shìwù xiàngzhēng zhe gāoguì.
examples.english: In the palace, jade ornaments symbolize nobility.
